intro: Cactus bonplandii, commonly known as the golden barrel cactus, is a species native to the dry regions of South America. It is characterized by its spherical shape and prominent, spiny areoles that bear clusters of white flowers. The plant has a thick, ribbed stem that stores water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. Its leaves are modified into spines, reducing water loss through transpiration. The flowers, which bloom in late spring, are a striking yellow and attract pollinators like bees and birds.
